I realized that this morning as I was in the shower rocking back and forth telling myself its not my fault... Seriously, don't give up on this one its a great idea, just make up with your friends and suck it up buttercup... Don't make us suffer for your bad choices... Kidding but app is awesome.

Like what I'm seeing so far with my Droid phone.  Any plans to develop a version for Mac iOS? Additionally, I'd have to echo the comments about an inability to cut & paste from decrypted messages.  You can obviously screen capture but this would not be at all helpful for very lengthy messages nor for further encoded data sent via a PixelKnot image. Thanks.
This works really well. I sent test messages and it worked perfectly!!

It does not explain how to open and retrieve msga from pictures. But upon 
reading comments i found a helpful explanation. Basically, once file is 
received, save it and open your photo folder. Once found, open it using 
Pixelknot. For some folks this part might be difficult to figure out.

While I love the concept‚Ä¶ this app doesn't work on Android P. It just

Agree with others: if you're gonna give the ability to paste into it, got 
to give the ability to copy from it. If a newbie pastes formatted text that 
comes out gibberish, could be readable IF able to copy to original 
application. Currently, impossible. If the message gets lengthy, shifts 
focus, so you can't see the point where the cursor is. For an app out so 
long, really lame of the dev to allow so much absent basic functionality 
bugs . If you're gonna offer something so half baked, why even bother 
writing it at all?

I would like to embed an already encrypted pgp message and receiving without the ability to copy and paste completely breaks it for me.
